newsitem.title: UK: Xenova to invest 15-18 million stg on research.
newsitem.headline: Xenova to invest 15-18 million stg on research.

text.p: UK biopharmaceutical firm Xenova Group Plc said on Thursday that it would invest a major portion of the proceeds of its share placing in developing its two lead drugs.

Louis Nisbet, chief executive of Xenova, said it would invest between 15 to 18 million stg on the Phase II stage of research on its anti-cancer drug XR 5000 and its multi drug resistance blocker XR 9051.
The company said it had raised 22.6 million stg on Thursday by issuing more than 10 million shares at 215p, giving it a market capitalisation of 50 million stg.
Trading in the shares is due to start on the London Stock Exchange on December 19.
Currently, the company's major source of revenue comes from major drug firms which use Xenova's "discovery technology," Nisbet said.
Warner-Lambert Co, Genentech Inc and Suntory are already Xenova's partners.
Genentech has an eight percent stake in the company which would drop to four percent after the listing.
Zeneca Plc is investing two million stg through a subscription for 930,000 shares or 4.37 percent of the firm's equity.
"Zeneca will help us in research on natural products," Nisbet told Reuters.
